page.title: 08UPMINSTER SHOPPING CENTRE
page.content: The retail core of Upminster runs along{Corbet's Tey Rd., Station Rd., & {St. Mary's Lane.}Due to changing shop- ping habits & more mobility{many small {specialised shops have closed,}& {nati0nal multiples moved}to bigger centres or out of town hypermarkets, within motoring distance. Rents have increased &{small shops have been {replaced by tertiary services. There are{7 Estate Agents, 5 Building {Societies, 4 Banks, 12 Restaurants. The remaining traditional shops include:-{4 bakeries, 4 greengrocers, {2 grocers, 1 fishmonger, 1 bookshop, 2 {stationers, 3 car showrooms, 2 public {houses, 3 travel agents, 4 newsagents, plus a large variety of others. {Boots, Woolworths, International, W.H. {Smiths, & Roomes}are the largest shops but it is feared that they may go the same way as{Sainsbury's which closed.
